snippet: As the Roman Catholic Church tries to grow in China, it increasingly finds itself in conflict with the authorities.
abstract: Roman Catholic Church, attempting to grow in China, has found itself increasingly in conflict with authorities there; some Catholic leaders and bishops have begun to break with the Chinese Patriotic Catholic Association, government group which maintains tight control over church operations.

byline.contributor: Ian Johnson contributed reporting, and Shi Da contributed research.

lead_paragraph: As the Roman Catholic Church tries to grow in China, it increasingly finds itself in conflict with the authorities.

headline.seo: In China, Tensions Between Church and Government
headline.main: Spreading the Faith Where Faith Itself Is Suspect
headline.print_headline: Spreading the Faith Where Faith Itself Is Suspect
